name: Durgeddin the Black
languages: Abyssal, Common, Dwarvish, Infernal, Primordial, Undercommon

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: Durgeddin has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Durgeddin fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Master of the Grave
entries: While within 30 feet of him, any undead ally of Durgeddin makes saving throws with advantage, and that ally regains 1d6 hit points whenever it starts its turn there.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If Durgeddin is destroyed but his phylactery remains intact, Durgeddin gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all his hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, Durgeddin has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: Durgeddin has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, Durgeddin magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, Durgeddin is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If Durgeddin lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Durgeddin magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment Durgeddin wears or carries is invisible with it.

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 ({@dice 3d6}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Benign Transposition
entries: Durgeddin teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. Alternatively, he can choose a space within range that is occupied by a Small or Medium creature. If that creature is willing, both creatures teleport, swapping places. Durgeddin can use this feature again only after he finishes a long rest or casts a conjuration spell of 1st level or higher.

legendary.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Durgeddin fixes his gaze on one creature he can see within 10 feet of him. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to Durgeddin's gaze for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Durgeddin is a 13th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 17, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:
